data.text:
@johnsgunn Read carefully:  nobody is saying Covid is over.  
The mandates are done.  
You can continue to operate as if they are still here.  
Fill your boots, but kindly mind your own fucking business.  
Fair?
@johnsgunn Never was clear...if testing isn't accurate.

@marceltrautmann I'm not sure - this is generated because I pull from the New Brunswick dashboard data API, but Ontario hasn't used the same.

HOWEVER - if they're no longer directly publishing it, check the Health Canada stats by province
@johnsgunn you have access to the ontario version?  or it doesn’t exist because no testing?
@johnsgunn Never mind, the 7 day averages take that into account with a rolling average of about 400
@johnsgunn I don't understand what I'm looking at. The graph lines vs axes don't make sense.
@johnsgunn @nb_covid_info Like that nugget @premierbhiggs cares about us poors, he’s demonstrated that enough times
@johnsgunn Are you including the 3 day increases as single data points and not putting 0s for the days with no reports? Not downplaying the severity of the situation, just checking your math
